name: Olena Teliha
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to Olena Ivanivna Teliha (1906 - 1942), a talented poetess and public figure. Olena Teliha was a poetess who left not very extensive, but rather significant artistic heritage. She was an organizer and a head of the Union of Ukrainian writers in Nazies-occupied Kyiv, she edited the `Timpani` periodical, a literary and artistic supplement to the `Ukrainian Word` newspaper.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above against the glass background there is the arciform inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), under which there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the left - the coin face-value – 2 / ГРИВНІ (2/Hryvnias), beneath – cherry blossom in flames and the logotype of the NBU Mint and 2007, the coin mintage year, are placed.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Olena Teliha is portrayed. To the right there are the inscriptions: 1906/1942 and arciform ОЛЕНА ТЕЛІГА (Olena Teliha).
